channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pigeons get stuck in wires, 5th September
item.description:
On the underside of the bridge there are wires to prevent pigeon nesting which I understand. However, the pigeons somehow get through and nest and find themselves stuck and they suffer greatly. One was stuck struggling to get out for over 24hours. Not sure if it's still there but it's a constant happening. I'm a Lewisham resident in Yeoman Street, so just around the corner and walk under that bridge daily.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A bus hit a street tree, which is now leaning over, 5th September
item.description:
A bus hit part of this tree, and a few nearby residents have expressed concern that the tree is leaning over and looks to be at danger of falling. TfL incident response came and the bus has now been removed but the tree looks hazardous, and one lane of the road (westward direction) is now blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upwood Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various Flytipped items Selborne Road, 5th September
item.description:
Various fly tipped items which have been in Selborne Road for over a week. For removal please. Thanks so much.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selborne Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trashwood Avenue (I mean Harewood Avenue) is covered in trash again…., 5th September
item.description:
Harewood Avenue is out of control. The pavement and road on the west side of the street are constantly littered / full of trash scattered everywhere. At this point the road should probably be renamed “Trashwood Avenue”, because this is a completely absurd, constant, and unhygienic problem. Shocking this has been acceptable to Westminster this year. It’s a high foot traffic street and Uber drivers (waiting for Marylebone Station fares) dump litter from their vehicles onto the street constantly. Please schedule someone to clean this street more frequently. And please fine people for littering here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Harewood Avenue, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No.22 HMO Puppy. Owner does not pick up dog mess!, 5th September
item.description:
Further to report number: 8056424 The occupant of the HMO who has a beige puppy in there, continuously lets the dog foul on the footpath and road and never picks his mess up!! Again by the parked cars on entrance to the road today and yesterday! Kids are treading in it!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Place, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant rubbish and mess in front of the recycling bins, 5th September
item.description:
Recycling bins area – At the back near the shops, the bins are continuously surrounded by mess and overspill, which really spoils the area. The bins aren’t being used as intended (in some cases being treated like open rubbish bins), and the space ends up looking neglected. Could these bins be removed, relocated, or at least better managed? The space could instead be made more welcoming – for example with plants, a bench, or a more maintained layout.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lingfield Crescent, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large wheelie bin, 5th September
item.description:
Large wheelie bin with no lid. Believe it’s the collection teams not a resident, reported one a couple of weeks ago which was promptly collected .seems to be a regular issue, there’s one also in Harcourt avenue junction with Rowley avenue . The trouble is dog walkers drop poo bags in them and having no lid the flies & smell are unpleasant.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowview, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed / Splintered Glass, 5th September
item.description:
